title: Restoration and Peace
shortSummary: Psalm 85 is a heartfelt prayer for God's mercy, forgiveness, and restoration following a period of judgment and captivity. It expresses confidence in God's willingness to revive His people and highlights the harmonious relationship between mercy, truth, righteousness, and peace that God brings. This psalm encourages believers to trust in God's salvation and to seek His guidance in living faithfully.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - Post-exilic period or time of national restoration

keyCharacters.name: Sons of Korah
keyCharacters.description: A group of Levitical singers and temple musicians credited with composing this psalm, expressing communal prayer and worship.

keyCharacters.name: Jacob
keyCharacters.description: Representative of the nation of Israel, whose captivity and restoration are central themes in the psalm.

outline.heading: God’s Past Favor and Forgiveness
outline.description: The psalm opens by recalling God's gracious restoration of Israel from captivity, His forgiveness of their sins, and the removal of His anger, emphasizing His mercy and faithfulness.

outline.heading: A Plea for Renewal and Salvation
outline.description: The psalmist earnestly petitions God to turn His anger away and revive His people so they may rejoice in His salvation, highlighting the need for divine intervention and mercy.

outline.heading: God’s Promise of Peace and Righteousness
outline.description: The psalmist listens for God’s word of peace, affirming that salvation is near for those who fear Him. The closing verses poetically describe the meeting of mercy, truth, righteousness, and peace, portraying the blessings that come from God’s presence.

application: Trust in God’s mercy and forgiveness, remembering that He is willing to restore those who repent sincerely.
Approach God in prayer with humility, asking Him to revive your spirit and lead you in the way of righteousness.
Seek to embody the qualities of mercy, truth, righteousness, and peace in your daily relationships as a reflection of God’s character.
Be attentive to God’s voice and guidance, allowing His peace to guard your heart and direct your steps.

keyVerses.text: Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s gracious forgiveness, a foundational truth for believers seeking restoration.

keyVerses.text: I will hear what God the LORD will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the importance of listening to God’s word and embracing His peace while avoiding folly.

keyVerses.text: Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
keyVerses.significance: This poetic verse beautifully expresses the harmony of divine attributes that believers can experience through God’s salvation.
